title: Only getting 58fps (most of the time) on the Howling Abyss with a high end graphics card
body:
I got a new graphics card yesterday (3gb one, AMD r9 280x) and obviously pushed all the settings on league to max. I got home from work this afternoon and started up an ARAM. As I left the base, I noticed the normal 60fps was dipping to 58/59 pretty often (sounds pedantic but its noticable). I thought it might've been the snow or whatever, so I dropped the setting down a bit. Well even on Low with no Vsync/AA it was still sitting on that 58fps. 

Am I the only one having this issue?

replies.body:
It also depends on your CPU, your FPS can be reduced even if you have a super OP GFX card, if your CPU is too slow to handle the GFX card.

Also if your fps are 100000 it doesn't really matter if your 50hz / 60hz / 75hz monitor cant display it. find out what hz your monitor is and cap the fps at that number, no point in going any higher really + it makes your GFX card fan so much quieter.

I think you have to turn the refresh rate sync option off. Even though you have turned the frame rate cap off... the program is syncing you at your monitor's refresh rate... I had the same prob with a R9 280. Went from 58-60fps to 230-250fps!

It's the framerate cap. It tries to cap it at 60 but it's a few frames off. Remove the framerate cap.

Did you do a fresh uninstall and reinstall new drivers?

Nah didn't uninstall the old drivers, but when I loaded up the PC with the new card inside windows was running in a small resolution (700xsomething) so I assumed they were gone, so installed the new drivers. This is the only game having an issue too.

> Nah didn't uninstall the old drivers, but when I loaded up the PC with the new card inside windows was running in a small resolution (700xsomething) so I assumed they were gone, so installed the new drivers. This is the only game having an issue too.

Man, delete the old drivers asap, restart, and download new ones that fit your card.

Uninstalled the drivers, restarted, reinstalled the newest set of beta drivers. Created more problems than it solved. I'm now unable to even log in to League. So I guess it'll be a while before I see if I fixed the FPS issue :/

> Uninstalled the drivers, restarted, reinstalled the newest set of beta drivers. Created more problems than it solved. I'm now unable to even log in to League. So I guess it'll be a while before I see if I fixed the FPS issue :/

The servers aren't going so well at the moment, even if they were, logging in has nothing to do with your video card. Test it on another game while the servers are sh it.
As I said before, League was the only game having an issue. The only other game having an issue is Battlefield 3/4, and that isnt a problem with the card (happened with the last one too)

> As I said before, League was the only game having an issue. The only other game having an issue is Battlefield 3/4, and that isnt a problem with the card (happened with the last one too)

For league of legends to be struggling, there must be something wrong. My computer is ancient and I get 60 fps on max settings. I literally have a radeon HD 4800 series, which is terrible.

Did you try  disabled the cap on FPS?

Yeah disabling the cap didn't do anything oddly enough (neither did changing the cap to either 40/60/80). Ill give it another shot tomorrow when the servers are back. A while back League was only running at 58fps because of the animated HP/MP bars, but having a high end card should allow them to do whatever they want. Also disabling them didn't help, so who knows :/
Im rocking a 30fps average with a computer i bought only 3 months ago... so i would be frothing at 58fps lol.... your 2 fps dip makes me lol.
The issue is you're using AMD.
